snippet: U S West Inc. said yesterday that it had dropped residential users from a test of a new generation of smaller cellular telephones that run on fewer batteries. But the regional telephone company added medium-sized businesses and a local government ...
lead_paragraph: U S West Inc. said yesterday that it had dropped residential users from a test of a new generation of smaller cellular telephones that run on fewer batteries. But the regional telephone company added medium-sized businesses and a local government to the 10-month trial, which will begin in January. "Given the speed with which the Federal Communications Commission has acted to allot licenses, U S West no longer believed a market trial of residential customers would provide customer information in a time frame to be of value," the company said. The trial was originally scheduled for April 1994. U S West said results of the technical trial involving 300 businesses would be just as valid without residential users.

headline.main: RESIDENTIAL USERS DROPPED FROM CELLULAR PHONE TEST
